body: I can't reproduce this and it really sounds like a config issue. Does this work with an empty vim config?

Hi, I have the same problem.
I can confirm there is no problem with an empty neovim config. :/
Then it is a configuration issue, you've probably somewhere configured (neo)vim to paste from clipboard when middle mouse is pressed.

Hi, and thanks for your replies!

I have the issue in vim (I have never use neovim, so I can't tell for that one), with a .vimrc containing only the line set mouse=a
And with my usual config, removing the line mouse=a causes the issue to disappear.

However, this only happens to me with alacritty, i.e. with a vimrc containing only set mouse=a, I have the double paste in alacritty but not in xterm, gnome-terminal, konsole, xfce-terminal, urxvt.

Cheers!
Sounds to me like copy/pasting into/from system clipboard might be disabled in mouse mode, I'll look into how exactly other terminal emulators do it.

issue.title: Don't paste selection when in mouse mode
issue.body:
When the mouse mode is set using either 1000h, 1002h or 1003h, the
selection should not be pasted when hitting the middle mouse button,
because it is job of the application to handle this when mouse mode is
enabled.

This has been solved by checking for the current mouse modes whenever
the `PasteSelection` binding is invoked.

This fixes #1215.

body: @HerrmannM I've opened a PR that should fix this with #1218, can you confirm that this PR fixes the issue?

@chrisduerr Yes, this fixes the issue, thank you very much!
Cheers!
The pull request fixes the issue but breaks scroll wheel support on master 3d75c4.
The PR does not touch anything other than the `PasteSelection` action, are you sure that it broke scroll wheel support? Also what do you mean by "scroll wheel support" exactly @n1zzo?

Sorry for the cryptic message,
in my machine the alacritty client does not scroll whenever I scroll my scrollwheel.
However I just tried and this is totally independent from your patch,
in fact I just realized that only the [alacritty-scrollback-git](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/alacritty-scrollback-git/) AUR package has the scrollback support.
Sorry for the mess.

No problem, better to have one too many bug reports than missing one! :)

The `alacritty-scrollback-git` aur package currently uses the #1147 PR, once that is merged it will be available on the latest master.
So I've see too. The pasting is _spotty_. But my version is very old (pratically from release). I'll recompile to the current HEAD and try to recreate.
@valarauca The PR to fix this is not merged yet. So you'll have to wait until jwilm gets around to it.
